üöÄ MTM Custom Prompts Guide

Complete guide for new developers on using GitHub Copilot custom prompts effectively

üéØ What Are Custom Prompts?

Custom prompts are specialized instructions that tell GitHub Copilot exactly how to help you with specific tasks in the MTM WIP Application. Think of them as expert templates that guide the AI to give you better, more accurate assistance.

üéì New Developer Friendly

This guide assumes you're new to programming and will explain everything step-by-step. Don't worry about complex terminology - we'll cover it all!

üèóÔ∏è MTM Application Structure

The MTM WIP Application is a manufacturing inventory management system built with:

  • .NET 8 - The programming framework
  • Avalonia UI - Creates the user interface (what users see)
  • MVVM Pattern - Organizes code in a specific way
  • MySQL Database - Stores all the data

üìö How This Guide Works

  1. Available Prompts - See all the custom prompts and what they do
  2. Common Scenarios - Learn what to use for bug fixes, features, etc.
  3. File Reference - Understand which files to include
  4. Pro Tips - Advanced techniques for better results

üîß Common Development Scenarios

Here's what to use for different types of work:

üêõ
Bug Fixes & Code Issues

Best Prompt: Review and Refactor

üìÅ Files to Include:

  • #file:.github/copilot-instructions.md - Core patterns and standards
  • #file:.github/development-guides/MTM-MVVM-Patterns-Guide.md - MVVM best practices
  • #file:Views/[YourView].axaml - The UI file with the bug
  • #file:ViewModels/[YourViewModel].cs - The code behind file
  • #file:Services/ErrorHandling.cs - For error handling patterns
Example Command:
"Follow review-and-refactor instructions. I have a bug where the InventoryView crashes when clicking Save. #file:.github/copilot-instructions.md #file:Views/MainForm/InventoryView.axaml #file:ViewModels/MainForm/InventoryViewModel.cs"
üé®
UI Changes & Visual Updates

Best Prompts: MTM UI Documentation Audit + Documentation Writer

üìÅ Files to Include:

  • #file:.github/ui-ux/MTM-Design-System-Documentation.md - Design standards
  • #file:.github/ui-ux/MTM-Avalonia-Style-Guide.md - Avalonia-specific UI rules
  • #file:Resources/Themes/MTM_Blue.axaml - Theme colors and styles
  • #file:Views/[YourView].axaml - The view you're updating
  • #file:.github/copilot-instructions.md - Layout patterns
Example Command:
"Follow MTM UI Documentation Audit instructions. I need to update the RemoveTabView to match the new design system. #file:.github/ui-ux/MTM-Design-System-Documentation.md #file:Views/MainForm/RemoveTabView.axaml"

New Features & Functionality

Best Prompts: Feature PRD Breakdown ‚Üí Feature Implementation Breakdown ‚Üí GitHub Issue Creation

üìÅ Files to Include:

üí° Smart File Selection Tips

‚ö†Ô∏è Don't Include Too Many Files

Including 10+ files can overwhelm the AI. Focus on the 3-5 most relevant files for your specific task.

File Selection Strategy

  • Start with core files - Always include copilot-instructions.md
  • Add category-specific files - UI files for UI work, database files for data work
  • Include the actual code - The specific files you're working with
  • Add related examples - Similar working code as reference
  • Skip unrelated files - Don't include testing files when working on UI

üí° Pro Tips for Better Results

üéØ Writing Effective Prompts

Structure Your Requests

  • Start with the prompt reference - Always begin with "Follow [prompt-name] instructions"
  • Be specific about what you want - "Fix the bug" vs "Fix the crash when clicking Save button"
  • Provide context - Explain what you were trying to do when the problem occurred
  • Include error messages - Copy the exact error text if there is one
  • Mention your skill level - "I'm new to C#" helps the AI adjust its explanations

üìù Template for Perfect Prompts

Follow [prompt-name] instructions. **What I'm trying to do:** [Describe your goal] **What's happening:** [Describe the current behavior or problem] **Error message (if any):** [Copy exact error text] **My experience level:** [New to programming / Familiar with C# / Expert, etc.] **Files:** #file:.github/copilot-instructions.md #file:[other relevant files]

üöÄ Advanced Techniques

üîÑ Iterative Refinement

Don't expect perfect results on the first try. Use follow-up prompts like:

  • "Make it simpler for a new developer"
  • "Add more comments to explain the code"
  • "Focus on the error handling part"
  • "Show me a working example"

üé® Context is King

The more context you provide, the better the results:

  • Business context: "This is for tracking manufacturing inventory"
  • User context: "Factory workers will use this on touch screens"
  • Technical context: "This connects to our MySQL database"
  • Timeline context: "This needs to be done by end of sprint"

üö® Common Mistakes to Avoid

  • Vague requests: "Fix my code" instead of describing the specific problem
  • No file references: Missing the #file: references means the AI lacks context
  • Wrong prompt choice: Using documentation-writer for code fixes
  • Information overload: Including every file in the project
  • Assuming knowledge: Not explaining your experience level

üéØ Success Metrics

You'll know you're doing it right when:

  • The AI gives you specific, actionable answers
  • Code suggestions follow the MTM patterns
  • You get explanations at your skill level
  • Solutions work on the first try most of the time
  • You're learning new concepts with each interaction
